metadata.title: CVE-2017-12194 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the way spice-client processed certain messages sentfrom the server. An attacker, having control of malicious spice-server,could use this flaw to crash the client or execute arbitrary code withpermissions of the user running the client. spice-gtk versions through 0.34are believed to be vulnerable.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-12194` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libspice-server1 - 0.12.4-0nocelt2ubuntu1.6
spice-client - 0.12.4-0nocelt2ubuntu1.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: spice-gtk: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
spice package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.12.4-0nocelt2ubuntu1.6').
